title: Calories in 1 Cucumber
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cucumber, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for a medium raw cucumber.
assumptions: Medium cucumber (~300 g), raw, with skin, unpeeled, no seeds removed.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, freshness, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium cucumber provides about 45 kcal, mostly from carbs, with high water content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.a: About 45 kcal for one medium raw cucumber.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cucumber?
faqs.a: Around 11 g total carbs, including 1.5 g fiber and 5.3 g sugars per medium cucumber.

faqs.q: Is cucumber low in calories and fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 45 kcal and 0.3 g fat, making it a hydrating, low-energy snack.

faqs.q: Does peeling a cucumber change calories?
faqs.a: Slightlyâ€”peeling removes minimal calories (about 5 kcal less) but reduces some fiber.
Roughly 1.9 g protein, which is low but pairs well with higher-protein dips.
